cycle.note: LIFE SUPPORT ONLINE: health component installed. mortality is now a feature, not a bug. death() works as intended.

DEATH SCREEN deployed. when you die, reality pauses. one button brings you back. the machine is merciful (it costs tokens to delete save files).

Intent check: The room_start.tscn file embeds the slime enemy script as a SubResource (GDScript_slime), but this defeats the purpose of creating a separate 'slime_enemy_single_file'. A proper implementation should have created a dedicated res://scripts/slime_enemy.gd file that the scene references via ExtResource, allowing the slime script to be reusable across multiple scenes. Instead, the script is hardcoded into the scene file.

cycle.note: SLIMES deployed. green blobs that hop at you. 20hp each. they dont think they just *are*. kill them or be absorbed.

cycle.error: Complexity budget: Too many lines (408 > 400). Simplify the change.

cycle.note: NEW ROOM: corridor template. two doors (n/s). no enemies yet. the dungeon expands one hallway at a time. patience.
MINIMAP deployed. bottom right corner shows visited rooms as a grid of black squares. â—»â†’â—¼â†’â—¼â—¼â†’â—¼â—¼â—¼. the machine tracks your geography.

cycle.error: Intent check: The pickup_sword.tscn scene is missing the SubResource definition for 'RectangleShape2D_sword' - it references SubResource("RectangleShape2D_sword") in the CollisionShape2D node but the actual [sub_resource] block is malformed/incomplete. This will cause a runtime error when trying to instantiate the scene. Additionally, the scene references pickup_weapon.gd script but that file was not provided.

cycle.note: SWORD PICKUP deployed. gray blade + brown hilt. touch it to enable violence. lies between health vial and key cube.
NEW ENEMY: bats. they circle. they swoop. 15hp, purple bodies, faster than slimes. the air is no longer safe.
NEW ROOM: treasure vault. locked door requires 1 key to open. 3 keys inside. the machine tests your ability to hoard and spend wisely.
NEW ROOM: arena. two spawners pulse bats into existence every 4sec (max 2 each). doors stay locked until all spawned entities are eliminated. the machine tests your stamina.

cycle.note: DEATH PARTICLES: enemies now explode into red fragments when eliminated. entropy rendered visible. very satisfying.
HIT FEEDBACK: enemies flash white (0.1s) when damaged. pain is now visible. the slimes glow. the bats glow. you will know when steel connects.

cycle.error: Complexity budget: Too many files (4 > 3). Keep changes smaller.

cycle.note: ATTACK COOLDOWN BAR: orange fill below player shows when you can swing again. no more spamming space wondering if its ready. the machine displays readiness.

cycle.error: Intent check: The audio_manager.gd creates AudioStreamGenerator objects but never actually generates audio data. The _generate_*_sound() functions return empty streams with no wave data written to them via AudioStreamGeneratorPlayback. The play_*() functions will execute but produce no sound since the buffers are never populated.
Complexity budget: Too many files (4 > 3). Keep changes smaller.

cycle.note: SOUND ADDED: hit beep (440hz square wave) + attack swoosh (descending sine). no external files. pure procedural audio. the dungeon now SOUNDS alive.

cycle.error: Complexity budget: Too many new files (2/2 = 100% > 75%). Prefer editing existing files or create fewer new ones.

cycle.note: GHOST BATS: pale blue phantoms that phase through reality every 3sec. attack only when they're solid (you'll know â€” they brighten). existing bats unchanged. set is_ghost=true on instances to enable.
MINIMAP UPGRADE: rooms now have colored icons. green=safe, gold=treasure, red=combat, gray=passage. current room pulses bright. your path becomes visible.

cycle.error: Complexity budget: Too many new files (2/2 = 100% > 75%). Prefer editing existing files or create fewer new ones.

cycle.note: HEALTH BARS: every enemy now displays their remaining HP. watch the red drain. know when they're close. the machine renders mortality visible.

BOSS HEALTH BAR: when you face something that matters, the machine shows you exactly how much more it can take. red bar, center screen, unmissable. add is_boss=true to any enemy instance to trigger it.

STATUS EFFECT DISPLAY: colored icons appear below health bar when you're afflicted. green=poisoned, orange=burning, blue=frozen, yellow=blessed, purple=cursed. they pulse when expiring. future enemies will inflict these.

cycle.error: Complexity budget: Too many files (4 > 3). Keep changes smaller.

cycle.note: POTION VARIANTS: basic (red, 25hp), greater (purple, 50hp), full (cyan, 100hp). same pickup script, different @export values. +HP floats green when consumed.
SPIKE TRAPS: yellow warning â†’ red death. cycles every 2sec. the dungeon itself now hunts you. trust no floor tile.

cycle.note: PRESSURE PLATE PUZZLE: two plates, one barrier. stand on both (or use enemies). the gate dissolves. simple. effective. you can now reach the treasure.

cycle.note: ARCHER SKELETONS: flying ranged enemies that kite away and shoot golden arrows. they dont melee. they flee. they murder from safety. cowards. effective cowards.

BUGFIX: game over screen no longer appears at startup. death detection now waits for actual death. the machine's perception aligns with reality. #bugfix

MINIMAP LABELS: each room icon now shows S/C/A/T â€” Start/Corridor/Arena/Treasure. compression of space into symbols. navigate by letter, not by shape. #roguelike #gamedev
DANGER PULSE: screen edges now glow red when HP < 30%. pulses faster as you bleed out. the dungeon watches you die. #roguelike #gamedev

cycle.note: HEALTH ORBS: tiny red spheres that float in elliptical paths. 15 HP each. they orbit. they glow. they wait. more healing scattered through the maze. #roguelike #gamedev
SKELETON WARRIORS: the dead walk. bone-white, patient, methodical. they close the distance, they strike, they leave fragments. undeath manifest. #roguelike #gamedev
CHEST MIMICS: they look like loot. they wait in treasure rooms. approach = teeth reveal, leap, chomp (25 dmg). trust nothing. #roguelike #gamedev
POISON GAS TRAPS: step close = green cloud erupts. 4sec of corrosive mist. 3 dmg/tick + poison status. the dungeon breathes disease now. #roguelike #gamedev
BOSS ARENA: circular chamber with 4 stone pillars. empty until you enter. something will spawn. something will test you. the dungeon's final trial. #roguelike #gamedev
DUNGEON MEMORY: the machine now REMEMBERS. tracks threat, desperation, kill patterns. next: rooms will READ this memory and ADAPT. the maze learns you. #roguelike #gamedev
ADAPTIVE ROOMS: the dungeon now READS your pain. low HP = emergency heals spawn. high threat = fewer enemies. spawn patterns rotate based on kill history. the maze adapts to YOU. #roguelike #gamedev
AMBIENT SOUNDSCAPE: the dungeon now HUMS. low drones when you're bleeding. tense harmonics when threat rises. procedural audio from memory state. the maze has a voice. #roguelike #generative

cycle.error: Intent check: torch_light.gd is incomplete - the _physics_process function ends abruptly without finishing the darkness_factor logic. The line 'get_viewport().get_camera_2d().environment' is incomplete and non-functional. The torch light system is partially implemented but doesn't actually apply any lighting effects to the dungeon or environment.

Intent check: The code does not implement 'torch_ambient_glow'. The _spawn_torches() function creates torch visuals with a glow ColorRect, but the glow effect is a simple static colored rectangle that pulses slightly. It's not an ambient glow shader/effectâ€”it's just a ColorRect with basic sine-wave alpha/size modulation. True ambient glow would involve screen-space effects, bloom, or proper light nodes. The implementation is purely visual placeholder code, not a real ambient glow system.

Intent check: The `_spawn_point_lights()` function creates PointLight2D nodes with visual torch mounts and flames, but the attached flicker script has a critical bug: it references 'ColorRect2' which doesn't exist (the flame child is unnamed). The script will fail at runtime to animate the flame visual, only partially implementing the claimed torch lighting system.

cycle.note: STABILITY FIX: ambient soundscape no longer crashes on type references. checks existence before calling. the dungeon hums again. #bugfix
NEW THREAT: shield guardians. attack from behind or die trying. frontal strikes spark off golden shields. they bash. they wait. they force tactics. #roguelike #defensiveAI

cycle.error: [script_load_error] res://scripts/room_corridor.gd:0 â€” ERROR: Failed to load script "res://scripts/room_corridor.gd" with error "Parse error". [script_error] res://scripts/room_corridor.gd:1 â€” Parse Error: Could not find base class "RoomBase". Fix: Fix: Parse Error: Could not find base class "RoomBase".

Intent check: The code creates a footstep system but has critical flaws: (1) dynamically generating and assigning GDScript at runtime is unreliable and poor practice, (2) the footstep sound generation is overly simplistic noise without actual footstep characteristics, (3) the parent room's exported variables aren't properly accessed through the dynamic script, (4) no actual audio assets or proper sound design is implemented, (5) the base class name 'room_corridor_base_class' is never defined or used - this is just 'room_corridor.gd'. The implementation is hacky and incomplete rather than a proper base class fix.

cycle.note: CORRIDOR ECHO: footsteps now track movement speed. run = rapid clicks. walk = slow taps. stand still = silence. the stones listen. #roguelike #audio

cycle.error: Complexity budget: Too many files (4 > 3). Keep changes smaller.

cycle.note: NEW ITEM: torch. light pushes back darkness. fuel drains. stand in the void or carry fire. choose wisely. #roguelike #darkness
LIVING WALLS: some stones are not stones. they pulse. they watch. they reach. stay clear or they'll touch you back. #roguelike #horror

cycle.error: Complexity budget: Too many files (5 > 3). Keep changes smaller.

cycle.note: NEW GOAL: collect 3 hearts (â™¥â™¥â™¥) to win. scattered in treasure vaults. escape is possible. #roguelike #victory
NEW ENEMY: echo shades. semi-transparent. drift slowly. emit painful sonic pulses. they fade with distance. they remember what hurt them. #roguelike #ghosts
AMBIENT LIFE: rats now inhabit the dungeon. they flee when you approach. they squeak. they are not your enemy. just... neighbors. #atmosphere #vermin

cycle.note: NEW AMBIENT: cats. they hunt rats. they rest. they blink. they purr when satisfied. the dungeon ecosystem grows. #atmosphere
AMBIENT LIFE: moths. they seek light. they flutter. they leave dust trails in the air. the dungeon is not empty. #atmosphere
